moves.2... d6: black declines the exchange & brings up queens pawn instead
moves.3... Nc6: black can't take back as the queen exchange would mean moving his king, preventing him from castling, so the horse comes out instead
moves.4... Bxd6: black responds, uses the opportunity to bring out his bishop - but is a pawn down
moves.5... Nf6: black continues to open his pieces out - really wants to castle !
moves.6... bxc6: black responds, but he has two stacked pawns which is not ideal !
moves.7. Nf3: white open out, looks to castle
moves.8... O-O: black responds before his horse is pinned
moves.10... Be7: black offers the queen exchange and protects knight to avoid disturbing kings pawn (potentially)
moves.11... Bb7: black lines up his castles & queen on the back row
moves.12... Rb8: black is ready to move ba6 to threaten queen & rook simultaneously
moves.14. Na3: this was whites chance to move her queen to safety :O(  horses are not good against the board edge as they cannot command so many squares
moves.15. Qa4: white can get a pawn at least
moves.15... Bxf1: black has a rook from white - a big plus
moves.16. Rxf1: white is weakened with this loss, takes the bishop
moves.17. Nc4: white decides to mobilise her horse, would be better to steal a pawn back
moves.17... Qd5: black protects c6 pawn, has written off a7 pawn
moves.18... Rxb2: black accepts the exchange, which is a good policy given a material advantage
moves.19... Rxa2: black takes a pawn and attacks whites queen
moves.20. Qxc7: white takes a pawn to !!! neither side seems to love their pawns !!!!
moves.21. Qg3: white moves queen to a more attacking rank
moves.21... c5: black moves pawn up to build pressure
moves.22. Qc7: white responds, but blacks pawn is well guarded
moves.22... c4: ....so he moves the pawn up another square
moves.23. Ne1: white threatens blacks rook, but has blocked in her own rook, who badly needs to come out & help !
moves.24. Qf4: white has no pieces out to assist her queen
moves.24... Rd1: black links the queen & rook, also freeing up the pawns movement on the c file
moves.25. Qe3 Rc8:
blacks other rook joins in - white resigns :O(

..thanks for the game ;o)
